org.teamfarce.mirch.screens

Class NarratorScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.teamfarce.mirch.screens.AbstractScreen
      • org.teamfarce.mirch.screens.NarratorScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class NarratorScreen
extends AbstractScreen
    This is the screen which displays the narrator and a defined speech To show the screen with the defined speech you do the following Have access to the game object (MIRCH). then do game.guiController.narratorScreen.setSpeech("");

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int currentFrames
      The current amount of render frames since the last added letter.
      private java.lang.String currentMessage
      This is the current string that is being displayed on the screen.
      private java.lang.String endMessage
      This is the full message that is to be displayed.
      (package private) static int FRAMES_PER_LETTER
      This is how many render frames that have to occur before the next letter is added to the currentMessage
      com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Stage narratorStage
      These are the variables used to show and draw the scene
      private com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Button prompt 
      private com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Label speech
      These are the 2 objects that are rendered onto the screen
      private com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin uiSkin

        private int currentFrames
